page.title: 16WILDLIFE IN LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: The area surrounding the village of Little Baddow is rich in wildlife. This is mainly due to the many unspoilt areas of woodland and grassland. The large areas of deciduous woodland provide homes for a host of small animals including hedgehogs, squirrels and badgers. A wide variety of British bird life can also be spotted; it is common to see Jays, Woodpeckers, and many species of Owls. Keen amateur ornitholgists frequent the area. As yet, however, there are no permanent facilities for bird watching. Equally, the grassland areas attract hares, stoats, foxes and rabbits. Hopefully in the future there will be enough interest in the ecology of the area to create a nature reserve.
